title: Gallery Conversation: Faith in Colonial South America
hero_caption: <p>Unidentified artist, active in South America. <em>Saint Francis Xavier</em>, 18th century. Carl and Marilynn Thoma Collection.</p>
description:
Join curator Rebecca Long and Father Scott Hendrickson, a Jesuit Chaplain and Assistant Professor of Spanish at Loyola University, for an in-gallery conversation about faith in colonial South America in the exhibition Doctrine and Devotion: Art of the Religious Orders in the Spanish Andes.

Space is limited and on a first-come, first-served basis. Please plan on arriving early.

*Museum admission is free for Illinois residents every Thursday, 5:00–8:00—including during this event.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
